intro: Euphrasia odontites, commonly known as the toothed eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia odontites is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye ailments and respiratory conditions. Its delicate appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native range.
